argument.name: obj
argument.description: A pointer to a form, browse, or child object on a form or browse.

item.name: Form
item.description:
Specifies V4 compatibility for a form.
.T. = If user right clicks on a Locked Field, and no right-click menu is defined for that field and if a right-click menu is defined for the form, then the right-click menu for the form is used.
.F. = Iif user right clicks on a Locked Field, and no right-click menu is defined for that field.
'then system Field Lock menu is show, regardless of whether a right-click menu is defined for the form.

item.name: Browse
item.description:
Specifies the region selected for a browse.
"row" = Row selected
"column" = Column selected

item.name: Browses (for <OBJECT> use either the <BROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for <OBJECT> use either the <FORM> pointer or the name of the form)

section.description: The <OBJECT>.RIGHTCLICK() method displays the Right Click menu for the selected object. Limitations: Desktop applications only.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following example displays a right click menu.

section.example: dim ptr as P dim pchild as P ptr = form.load("Travel Time") pchild = ptr.child("ThisWeather") ? ptr.rightclick(pchild, "")
